what-is-peth.title: What is PETH?
what-is-peth.markdown: Collateralized ether is held in escrow inside a smart contract and users are issued pooled ether (PETH) in return. A user's PETH holdings represent a percentage share of the total pool of collateral assets, and the exchange rate can fluctuate based on the value of the derivative.

how-does-the-avatar-work.title: How does the avatar work?
how-does-the-avatar-work.markdown:
This special avatar is called an identicon, and is a unique image that is generated using the address of your Ethereum account.
It is a way to help you visually identify your different accounts.
